security: Disclosing that Hidalgo assisted the FBI as a member of the Communist Party from August 1946 until May 1949 when he appeared as a government witness at the trial of the eleven top CP Leaders could potentially reveal previously undisclosed intelligence operations. Quoting directly: 'HIDALGO ASSISTED THE FBI AS A MEMBER OF THE COMMUNIST PARTY FROM AUGUST 1946 UNTIL MAY 1949 WHEN HE APPEARED AS A GOVERNMENT WITNESS AT THE TRIAL OF THE ELEVEN TOP CP LEADERS.'
summary: This memo details the employment history and security clearances of Balmes N. Hidalgo, Jr., including his prior assistance to the FBI as a member of the Communist Party and his operational clearance for use as an agent in Latin America.
summary_one_paragraph: This document provides information on Balmes N. Hidalgo, Jr., a GS-11 employee in the WH Division, noting his hospitalization in early March 1962 and unspecified current medical status. The memo also details Hidalgo's past work with the FBI as a Communist Party member from August 1946 to May 1949, during which he testified as a government witness. Before becoming a staff employee, Hidalgo worked as a contract employee, obtaining an operational clearance for use as an agent in Latin America in December 1951 and a covert security clearance in 1952. The file also mentions that Hidalgo's mother, Annie Louise Hidalgo, had a covert security approval for clerical work, and references attached files for both.
